poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of the Tower"

Blackpool lights, flickers hide the flaws,
A facade, masking sins of South Shore.
Courthouse silent, justice retires,
Trust sinks, faith in Benton mires.
A town of mirth, now feels the scorn,
For the scoundrel who left it worn.
Yet, beneath the glitz, a yearning heart,
For a dawn's fresh light, a new start.
Beyond Benton, Blackpool shall comeback,
Revealing truth, where lies lack.
